remarks.para: The is typically used within the context of sited components or a design environment. Without a component site or a usable , this converter is of little use.
This converter converts a reference of an object that implements the interface and displays its properties in the Properties window.
For more information about type converters, see the base class and How to: Implement a Type Converter.

block.para: You should never create an instance of the class. Instead, call the method of the class. For more information, see the examples in the base class.

remarks.para: This class provides the method to check whether a particular value can be added to the standard values collection. If you do not want to add the value to the collection, override this method.

summary.para: Provides a type converter to convert object references to and from other representations.
